article.headline: Georgia 78, Howard 72
article.story: ATHENS, Ga. (AP) -- Levi Stukes scored 22 points, and Georgia hit nine free throws in the last three minutes to beat Howard 78-72 Monday. Trailing by 11 at halftime, Howard outscored Georgia 15-4 over the first 5½ minutes of the second half, tying the score at 46 when Dominique Davis hit one of two free throws with 14:29 remaining. Georgia (10-3) then went on an 8-0 run to take the lead for good. Three times Howard (2-8), alma mater of Georgia coach Dennis Felton, closed within three points, the last time at 62-59 after James McBryde's short jumper with 6:50 to play. Georgia then pulled away again, and Younes Idrissi scored on a lob pass to give Georgia a 69-60 lead with 4:23 left. That was Georgia's last field goal. Howard rallied once more and Darek Mitchell hit three free throws with 17 seconds to play, closing the gap to 74-70. But two free throws apiece by Gaines and Channing Toney sealed the win for the Bulldogs, who start Southeastern Conference play later this week. Sundiata Gaines scored 16 points for Georgia. Will Gant led Howard with 13 points, and Louis Ford and Eugene Myatt scored 12 apiece.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
